name: Lithium Americas Corp.
description: Lithium Americas Corp. is a leading resource company focused on advancing lithium projects in North America to meet the growing demand for lithium in electric vehicle batteries and energy storage systems. Founded in 2009, Lithium Americas is dedicated to developing its flagship projects, the Thacker Pass project in Nevada and the Cauchari-Olaroz project in Argentina, both of which are poised to play a critical role in the global transition to sustainable energy. The Thacker Pass project is one of the largest known lithium resources in the United States, strategically positioned to supply lithium hydroxide to the North American market. The Cauchari-Olaroz project, in partnership with Ganfeng Lithium, is expected to be one of the largest lithium brine operations in the world. With a strong commitment to sustainability and community engagement, Lithium Americas prioritizes environmentally responsible practices and aims to contribute to reducing greenhouse gas emissions through its products. The company is well-positioned to capitalize on the increasing demand for lithium as the automotive industry shifts towards electrification and renewable energy solutions.

faq.question: What is Lithium Americas known for?
faq.answer: Lithium Americas is known for its lithium resource projects, particularly the Thacker Pass and Cauchari-Olaroz projects.

faq.question: Who is the CEO of Lithium Americas?
faq.answer: Jonathan Evans is the CEO of Lithium Americas Corp.

faq.question: Where is Lithium Americas headquartered?
faq.answer: Lithium Americas is headquartered in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada.

faq.question: What are Lithium Americas' main products?
faq.answer: Lithium Americas primarily produces lithium hydroxide and lithium carbonate.
